text: More Proverbs of Solomon
These are also proverbs of Solomon which officials of Hezekiah king of Judah copied:
The glory of God\f + \fr 25:2 \ft Or “gods” \f* conceals things,
but the glory of kings searches out things.
As heaven is to height and the earth is to depth,
so \add is\add* the heart\f + \fr 25:3 \ft Or “mind” \f* of kings—there is no searching.
Remove the dross from silver,
and it will become a vessel for the smith.
Remove the wicked before a king,
and his throne will be established in righteousness.\f + \fr 25:5 \ft Hebrew “in the righteousness” \f*
Do not promote yourself before the king,
and in the place of the great ones do not stand.
For \add it is\add* better \add that\add* he say to you, “Ascend here,”
than he humble you before a noble.
What your eyes have seen,
do not hastily bring out to court,
for\f + \fr 25:8 \ft Or “lest” \f* what will you do at its end,
when your neighbor puts you to shame?
Argue your argument with your neighbor \add himself\add*,
the secret of another do not disclose,
lest he who hears shame you
and your ill repute will not end.
Apples of gold in a setting of silver
is a matter spoken at\f + \fr 25:11 \ft Hebrew “on” \f* its proper time.
A ring of gold and an ornament of fine gold
\add is\add* a rebuke of the wise to the ear of a listener.
Like the cold of snow on a day\f + \fr 25:13 \ft Or “at a season” \f* of harvest
\add is\add* a faithful messenger to those who send him,
and the soul\f + \fr 25:13 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f* of his master is refreshed.\f + \fr 25:13 \ft Or “returned” \f*
\add Like\add* clouds and wind when there is no rain,
\add so too is\add* a man who boasts in a gift of deception.
⸤With patience⸥\f + \fr 25:15 \ft Literally “With length of face” \f* a ruler may be persuaded,
and a soft tongue will break a bone.\f + \fr 25:15 \ft Or “strength” \f*
\add If\add* you find honey, eat what is sufficient for you,
lest you have your fill of it and vomit it out.
Make your foot scarce in the house of your neighbor,
lest he become weary of you and hate you.
\add Like\add* a club and sword and a sharp arrow
\add is\add* a man who bears false witness against his neighbor.
A bad tooth and a lame foot
\add is\add* the trust of a faithless person ⸤in a time⸥\f + \fr 25:19 \ft Literally “on a day” \f* of trouble.
\add Like\add* one who removes a garment on a cold day, \add or like\add* vinegar on natron,\f + \fr 25:20 \ft A mineral salt found on dry lake beds often used as a preservative. \f*
\add is\add* he who sings songs to a heavy heart.
If your enemy \add is\add* hungry, feed him bread,
and if thirsty, let him drink water.
For coals of fire you will heap upon his head,
and Yahweh will reward you.
The wind of the north produces rain,
and a backbiting tongue, angry faces.
Better to live upon the corner of a roof
than \add with\add* a woman\f + \fr 25:24 \ft Or “wife” \f* of contention and \add in a\add* shared house.
\add Like\add* cold water\f + \fr 25:25 \ft Hebrew “waters” \f* upon a weary soul,\f + \fr 25:25 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
\add so too is\add* good news from a distant place.
\add Like\add* a muddied spring or a polluted fountain
is the righteous who gives way before the wicked.
To eat much honey is not good,
nor \add is\add* seeking one’s honor\f + \fr 25:27 \ft Hebrew “their honor” \f* honorable.
A breached city \add where\add* there is no wall
\add is like\add* a man who ⸤has no⸥\f + \fr 25:28 \ft Literally “there is no” \f* self-control for his spirit.
